channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: YOLOv7: Trainable bag-of-freebies sets new state-of-the-art for real-time object detectors
item.description: YOLOv7 surpasses all known object detectors in both speed and accuracy in the range from 5 FPS to 160 FPS and has the highest accuracy 56. 8% AP among all known real-time object detectors with 30 FPS or higher on GPU V100.

item.title: Towards Grand Unification of Object Tracking
item.description: We present a unified method, termed Unicorn, that can simultaneously solve four tracking problems (SOT, MOT, VOS, MOTS) with a single network using the same model parameters.

item.title: Masked Autoencoders that Listen
item.description: Following the Transformer encoder-decoder design in MAE, our Audio-MAE first encodes audio spectrogram patches with a high masking ratio, feeding only the non-masked tokens through encoder layers.

item.title: Ivy: Templated Deep Learning for Inter-Framework Portability
item.description: We introduce Ivy, a templated Deep Learning (DL) framework which abstracts existing DL frameworks.

item.title: The Web Is Your Oyster -- Knowledge-Intensive NLP against a Very Large Web Corpus
item.description: In order to address increasing demands of real-world applications, the research for knowledge-intensive NLP (KI-NLP) should advance by capturing the challenges of a truly open-domain environment: web-scale knowledge, lack of structure, inconsistent quality and noise.

item.title: Colossal-AI: A Unified Deep Learning System For Large-Scale Parallel Training
item.description: The Transformer architecture has improved the performance of deep learning models in domains such as Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing.

item.title: Structure PLP-SLAM: Efficient Sparse Mapping and Localization using Point, Line and Plane for Monocular, RGB-D and Stereo Cameras
item.description: This paper demonstrates a visual SLAM system that utilizes point and line cloud for robust camera localization, simultaneously, with an embedded piece-wise planar reconstruction (PPR) module which in all provides a structural map.

item.title: Towards Metrical Reconstruction of Human Faces
item.description: To this end, we take advantage of a face recognition network pretrained on a large-scale 2D image dataset, which provides distinct features for different faces and is robust to expression, illumination, and camera changes.

item.title: Mask DINO: Towards A Unified Transformer-based Framework for Object Detection and Segmentation
item.description: In this paper we present Mask DINO, a unified object detection and segmentation framework.

item.title: Language Modelling with Pixels
item.description: Language models are defined over a finite set of inputs, which creates a vocabulary bottleneck when we attempt to scale the number of supported languages.

item.title: Bootstrapped Masked Autoencoders for Vision BERT Pretraining
item.description: The first design is motivated by the observation that using a pretrained MAE to extract the features as the BERT prediction target for masked tokens can achieve better pretraining performance.

item.title: Accelerated Quality-Diversity for Robotics through Massive Parallelism
item.description: With recent advances in simulators that run on accelerators, thousands of evaluations can now be performed in parallel on single GPU/TPU.

item.title: ObjectBox: From Centers to Boxes for Anchor-Free Object Detection
item.description: We present ObjectBox, a novel single-stage anchor-free and highly generalizable object detection approach.

item.title: More ConvNets in the 2020s: Scaling up Kernels Beyond 51x51 using Sparsity
item.description: Built on this recipe, we propose Sparse Large Kernel Network (SLaK), a pure CNN architecture equipped with 51x51 kernels that can perform on par with or better than state-of-the-art hierarchical Transformers and modern ConvNet architectures like ConvNeXt and RepLKNet, on ImageNet classification as well as typical downstream tasks.

item.title: XMem: Long-Term Video Object Segmentation with an Atkinson-Shiffrin Memory Model
item.description: We present XMem, a video object segmentation architecture for long videos with unified feature memory stores inspired by the Atkinson-Shiffrin memory model.

item.title: Visual Prompt Tuning
item.description: The current modus operandi in adapting pre-trained models involves updating all the backbone parameters, ie, full fine-tuning.

item.title: Betty: An Automatic Differentiation Library for Multilevel Optimization
item.description: Multilevel optimization has been widely adopted as a mathematical foundation for a myriad of machine learning problems, such as hyperparameter optimization, meta-learning, and reinforcement learning, to name a few.

item.title: BERTopic: Neural topic modeling with a class-based TF-IDF procedure
item.description: BERTopic generates coherent topics and remains competitive across a variety of benchmarks involving classical models and those that follow the more recent clustering approach of topic modeling.

item.title: Learning Implicit Templates for Point-Based Clothed Human Modeling
item.description: We present FITE, a First-Implicit-Then-Explicit framework for modeling human avatars in clothing.

item.title: Volatility Based Kernels and Moving Average Means for Accurate Forecasting with Gaussian Processes
item.description: A broad class of stochastic volatility models are defined by systems of stochastic differential equations.
